comments.body: I really like the simplification here.

Any chance to get a field for the file contents? As I've mentioned elsewhere, this would make a persisted database self-contained and more robust to outside factors like changing file contents. The way we parse an AttributedSource would then work like this

- if path AND contents are non-empty, use Input.LabeledString
- if only path is non-empty, use Input.File
- if both are empty, ???

Additionally, we may want to add a `checksum` field that can be used in combination with Input.File to ensure that the read file contents match the file contents that produced this semanticdb.

Following discussions from https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/issues/777 .

I propose that we name this field `relative_path` and add a comment explaining that an absolute "source root" path is required at mirror construction time to turn `relative_path` into an absolute path.
I suggest that we discuss this separately from this pull request. Initially, I planned to handle #777 here, but I quickly found that it's hairy. Later today, I will add my thoughts to that ticket.
